member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.AmazonIoTJobsDataPlaneClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing IoTJobsDataPlane
AWS IoT Jobs is a service that allows you to define a set of jobs â€” remote operations that are sent to and executed on one or more devices connected to AWS IoT. For example, you can define a job that instructs a set of devices to download and install application or firmware updates, reboot, rotate certificates, or perform remote troubleshooting operations.
To create a job, you make a job document which is a description of the remote operations to be performed, and you specify a list of targets that should perform the operations. The targets can be individual things, thing groups or both.
AWS IoT Jobs sends a message to inform the targets that a job is available. The target starts the execution of the job by downloading the job document, performing the operations it specifies, and reporting its progress to AWS IoT. The Jobs service provides commands to track the progress of a job on a specific target and for all the targets of the job

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.AmazonIoTJobsDataPlaneClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonIoTJobsDataPlaneClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The URL of the search or document service.

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.AmazonIoTJobsDataPlaneClient.UpdateJobExecution(Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest)
member.summary: Updates the status of a job execution.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateJobExecution service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateJobExecution service method, as returned by IoTJobsDataPlane.
member.exception: The contents of the request were invalid. For example, this code is returned when an UpdateJobExecution request contains invalid status details. The message contains details about the error.

An update attempted to change the job execution to a state that is invalid because of the job execution's current state (for example, an attempt to change a request in state SUCCESS to state IN_PROGRESS). In this case, the body of the error message also contains the executionState field.
The specified resource does not exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateJobExecution Operation

The specified resource does not exist.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.DescribeJobExecutionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeJobExecution operation. Gets details of a job execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.DescribeJobExecutionRequest.ExecutionNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionNumber.
Optional. A number that identifies a particular job execution on a particular device. If not specified, the latest job execution is returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.DescribeJobExecutionRequest.IncludeJobDocument
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeJobDocument.
Optional. When set to true, the response contains the job document. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.DescribeJobExecutionRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier assigned to this job when it was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.DescribeJobExecutionRequest.ThingName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThingName.
The thing name associated with the device the job execution is running on.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.DescribeJobExecutionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeJobExecution operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.DescribeJobExecutionResponse.Execution
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Execution.
Contains data about a job execution.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetPendingJobExecutions operation. Gets the list of all jobs for a thing that are not in a terminal status.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.GetPendingJobExecutionsRequest.ThingName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThingName.
The name of the thing that is executing the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.GetPendingJobExecutionsResponse.InProgressJobs
member.summary:

A list of JobExecutionSummary objects with status IN_PROGRESS.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.GetPendingJobExecutionsResponse.QueuedJobs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedJobs.
A list of JobExecutionSummary objects with status QUEUED.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution
member.summary: Contains data about a job execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.ApproximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApproximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut.
The estimated number of seconds that remain before the job execution status will be changed to TIMED_OUT.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.ExecutionNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionNumber.
A number that identifies a particular job execution on a particular device. It can be used later in commands that return or update job execution information.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.JobDocument
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobDocument.
The content of the job document.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.LastUpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdatedAt.
The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.QueuedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedAt.
The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was enqueued.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.StartedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartedAt.
The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was started.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the job execution. Can be one of: "QUEUED", "IN_PROGRESS", "FAILED", "SUCCESS", "CANCELED", "REJECTED", or "REMOVED".

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.StatusDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusDetails.
A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.ThingName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThingName.
The name of the thing that is executing the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecution.VersionNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VersionNumber.
The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are incremented each time they are updated by a device.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionState
member.summary: Contains data about the state of a job execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionState.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the job execution. Can be one of: "QUEUED", "IN_PROGRESS", "FAILED", "SUCCESS", "CANCELED", "REJECTED", or "REMOVED".

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionState.StatusDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusDetails.
A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionState.VersionNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VersionNumber.
The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are incremented each time they are updated by a device.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionSummary
member.summary: Contains a subset of information about a job execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionSummary.ExecutionNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionNumber.
A number that identifies a particular job execution on a particular device.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionSummary.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionSummary.LastUpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdatedAt.
The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionSummary.QueuedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueuedAt.
The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was enqueued.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionSummary.StartedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartedAt.
The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.JobExecutionSummary.VersionNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VersionNumber.
The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are incremented each time AWS IoT Jobs receives an update from a device.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.StartNextPendingJobExecutionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartNextPendingJobExecution operation. Gets and starts the next pending (status IN_PROGRESS or QUEUED) job execution for a thing.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.StartNextPendingJobExecutionRequest.StatusDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusDetails.
A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job execution. If not specified, the statusDetails are unchanged.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.StartNextPendingJobExecutionRequest.StepTimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StepTimeoutInMinutes.
Specifies the amount of time this device has to finish execution of this job. If the job execution status is not set to a terminal state before this timer expires, or before the timer is reset (by calling UpdateJobExecution, setting the status to IN_PROGRESS and specifying a new timeout value in field stepTimeoutInMinutes) the job execution status will be automatically set to TIMED_OUT. Note that setting this timeout has no effect on that job execution timeout which may have been specified when the job was created (CreateJob using field timeoutConfig).

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.StartNextPendingJobExecutionRequest.ThingName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThingName.
The name of the thing associated with the device.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.StartNextPendingJobExecutionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartNextPendingJobExecution operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.StartNextPendingJobExecutionResponse.Execution
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Execution.
A JobExecution object.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateJobExecution operation. Updates the status of a job execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.ExecutionNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionNumber.
Optional. A number that identifies a particular job execution on a particular device.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.ExpectedVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpectedVersion.
Optional. The expected current version of the job execution. Each time you update the job execution, its version is incremented. If the version of the job execution stored in Jobs does not match, the update is rejected with a VersionMismatch error, and an ErrorResponse that contains the current job execution status data is returned. (This makes it unnecessary to perform a separate DescribeJobExecution request in order to obtain the job execution status data.)

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.IncludeJobDocument
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeJobDocument.
Optional. When set to true, the response contains the job document. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.IncludeJobExecutionState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeJobExecutionState.
Optional. When included and set to true, the response contains the JobExecutionState data. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier assigned to this job when it was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The new status for the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, FAILED, SUCCESS, or REJECTED). This must be specified on every update.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.StatusDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusDetails.
Optional. A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job execution. If not specified, the statusDetails are unchanged.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.StepTimeoutInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StepTimeoutInMinutes.
Specifies the amount of time this device has to finish execution of this job. If the job execution status is not set to a terminal state before this timer expires, or before the timer is reset (by again calling UpdateJobExecution, setting the status to IN_PROGRESS and specifying a new timeout value in this field) the job execution status will be automatically set to TIMED_OUT. Note that setting or resetting this timeout has no effect on that job execution timeout which may have been specified when the job was created (CreateJob using field timeoutConfig).

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest.ThingName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThingName.
The name of the thing associated with the device.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateJobExecution operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionResponse.ExecutionState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionState.
A JobExecutionState object.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionResponse.JobDocument
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobDocument.
The contents of the Job Documents.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.IAmazonIoTJobsDataPlane
member.summary:
Interface for accessing IoTJobsDataPlane
AWS IoT Jobs is a service that allows you to define a set of jobs â€” remote operations that are sent to and executed on one or more devices connected to AWS IoT. For example, you can define a job that instructs a set of devices to download and install application or firmware updates, reboot, rotate certificates, or perform remote troubleshooting operations.
To create a job, you make a job document which is a description of the remote operations to be performed, and you specify a list of targets that should perform the operations. The targets can be individual things, thing groups or both.
AWS IoT Jobs sends a message to inform the targets that a job is available. The target starts the execution of the job by downloading the job document, performing the operations it specifies, and reporting its progress to AWS IoT. The Jobs service provides commands to track the progress of a job on a specific target and for all the targets of the job

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.IAmazonIoTJobsDataPlane.DescribeJobExecution(Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.DescribeJobExecutionRequest)
member.summary: Gets details of a job execution.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeJobExecution service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeJobExecution service method, as returned by IoTJobsDataPlane.
member.exception: The contents of the request were invalid. For example, this code is returned when an UpdateJobExecution request contains invalid status details. The message contains details about the error.
The specified resource does not exist.
The job is in a terminal state.

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.IAmazonIoTJobsDataPlane.UpdateJobExecution(Amazon.IoTJobsDataPlane.Model.UpdateJobExecutionRequest)
member.summary: Updates the status of a job execution.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateJobExecution service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateJobExecution service method, as returned by IoTJobsDataPlane.
member.exception: The contents of the request were invalid. For example, this code is returned when an UpdateJobExecution request contains invalid status details. The message contains details about the error.

An update attempted to change the job execution to a state that is invalid because of the job execution's current state (for example, an attempt to change a request in state SUCCESS to state IN_PROGRESS). In this case, the body of the error message also contains the executionState field.
The specified resource does not exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateJobExecution Operation
